24:I[78891,["529","static/chunks/529-b3a318fab494e03f.js","244","static/chunks/244-f8e89f92ed6eb924.js","839","static/chunks/839-b514104c7e948606.js","165","static/chunks/165-ae3b45f0d86ef78d.js","184","static/chunks/app/dashboard/roots/%5Broot%5D/page-e0a9e2c37c8cb20d.js"],"CardTitle"]
25:T4dc,You who believe, when you contract a debt for a stated term, put it down in writing: have a scribe write it down justly between you. No scribe should refuse to write: let him write as God has taught him, let the debtor dictate, and let him fear God, his Lord, and not diminish &#91;the debt&#93; at all. If the debtor is feeble-minded, weak, or unable to dictate, then let his guardian dictate justly. Call in two men as witnesses. If two men are not there, then call one man and two women out of those you approve as witnesses, so that if one of the two women should forget the other can remind her. Let the witnesses not refuse when they are summoned. Do not disdain to write the debt down, be it small or large, along with the time it falls due: this way is more equitable in God&rsquo;s eyes, more reliable as testimony, and more likely to prevent doubts arising between you. But if the merchandise is there and you hand it over, there is no blame on you if you do not write it down. Have witnesses present whenever you trade with one another, and let no harm be done to either scribe or witness, for if you did cause them harm, it would be a crime on your part. Be mindful of God, and He will teach you: He has full knowledge of everything26:T4dc,You who believe, when you contract a debt for a stated term, put it down in writing: have a scribe write it down justly between you. No scribe should refuse to write: let him write as God has taught him, let the debtor dictate, and let him fear God, his Lord, and not diminish &#91;the debt&#93; at all. If the debtor is feeble-minded, weak, or unable to dictate, then let his guardian dictate justly. Call in two men as witnesses. If two men are not there, then call one man and two women out of those you approve as witnesses, so that if one of the two women should forget the other can remind her. Let the witnesses not refuse when they are summoned. Do not disdain to write the debt down, be it small or large, along with the time it falls due: this way is more equitable in God&rsquo;s eyes, more reliable as testimony, and more likely to prevent doubts arising between you. But if the merchandise is there and you hand it over, there is no blame on you if you do not write it down. Have witnesses present whenever you trade with one another, and let no harm be done to either scribe or witness, for if you did cause them harm, it would be a crime on your part. Be mindful of God, and He will teach you: He has full knowledge of everything27:T1f90,<entryFree id="n8573" key="حَقِيقَةٌ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">حَقِيقَةٌ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">حقيق</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">حقيقه</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">حقيقة</orth>
                  </form> The <hi rend="ital">essence</hi> of a thing as meaning <hi rend="ital">that by being which a thing is what it is;</hi> [or <hi rend="ital">that in being which a thing consists;</hi>] as when we say that a rational animal is the <foreign lang="ar">حقيقة</foreign> of a human being: (KT:) or <hi rend="ital">that by being which a thing is what it is, considered with regard to its reality,</hi> is termed <foreign lang="ar">حَقِيقَةٌ</foreign>: considered with regard to its individuality, <foreign lang="ar">هُوِيَّةٌ</foreign>: and without regard thereto, <foreign lang="ar">مَاهِيَّةٌ</foreign>: (KT, TA:) <hi rend="ital">the ultimate and radical constituent</hi> of a thing. (Msb, TA.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  [Also The <hi rend="ital">essence</hi> of a thing as meaning the <hi rend="ital">property</hi> or <hi rend="ital">quality,</hi> or the <hi rend="ital">aggregate of properties</hi> or <hi rend="ital">qualities, whereby a thing is what it is;</hi> the <hi rend="ital">essential property</hi> or <hi rend="ital">quality,</hi> or the <hi rend="ital">aggregate of the essential properties</hi> or <hi rend="ital">qualities,</hi> of a thing; <hi rend="ital">that which constitutes the particular and distinguishing nature</hi> of a thing or of a genus or species; <hi rend="ital">i. q.</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">ذَاتِيَّةٌ</foreign>: and] the <hi rend="ital">truth, reality,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">true</hi> or <hi rend="ital">real nature</hi> or <hi rend="ital">state</hi> [or <hi rend="ital">circumstances</hi> or <hi rend="ital">facts,</hi> the <hi rend="ital">very nature,</hi> and the <hi rend="ital">gist,</hi> and the <hi rend="ital">pith, marrow,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">most essential part</hi>], of a case, or an affair: pl. <foreign lang="ar">حَقَائِقُ</foreign>: see 3. (TA.) One says, <foreign lang="ar">بَلَغَ حَقِيقَةَ الأَمْرِ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He arrived at</hi> [the knowledge of] <hi rend="ital">the truth, reality,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">true</hi> or <hi rend="ital">real nature</hi> or <hi rend="ital">state</hi> [&amp;c.], <hi rend="ital">of the case,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">affair.</hi> (TA.) And   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8573-1" target="الحَقَّةُ" n="1" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign> signifies <foreign lang="ar">حَقِيقَةُ الأَمْرِ</foreign>; (S, K;) as also   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8573-2" target="الحَاقَّةُ" n="2" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign>. (TA.) Hence the saying, <foreign lang="ar">لَمَّا عَرَفَ  <ref cref="n8573-3" target="الحَقَّةَ" n="3" type="6" subtype="FTFSO" lang="ar"/> مِنِّى هَرَبَ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">When he knew the truth, reality,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">true</hi> or <hi rend="ital">real nature</hi> or <hi rend="ital">state</hi> &amp;c., <hi rend="ital">of the case,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">affair, from me, he fled</hi>]. (S, TA.) And <foreign lang="ar">لَمَّا رَأَى <ref cref="n8573-4" target="الحَاقَّةَ" n="4" type="5" subtype="FSO" lang="ar"/>مِنِّى هَرَبَ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">When he saw the truth,</hi> &amp;c.]. (TA.) [<foreign lang="ar">حَقِيقَةً</foreign> is often used as meaning <hi rend="ital">In truth,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">truly; in reality,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">really;</hi> and <hi rend="ital">in fact.</hi>] You say also, <foreign lang="ar">عَرَفْتُهُ حَقِيقَةَ المَعْرِفَةِ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">I knew it with reality of knowledge</hi>]. (Msb in art. <foreign lang="ar">كنه</foreign>.) And <foreign lang="ar">حَقِيقَةُ الإِيمَانِ</foreign> means <hi rend="ital">Genuine belief</hi> or <hi rend="ital">faith; reality of belief</hi> or <hi rend="ital">faith.</hi> (TA.) [And you say, <foreign lang="ar">هٰذَا شَىْءٌ لَا حَقِيقَةَ لَهُ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">This is a thing having no reality.</hi>]       <sense type="A" n="2">-A2-</sense>  [Also <hi rend="ital">A word,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">phrase, used in its proper</hi> or <hi rend="ital">original,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in a proper</hi> or <hi rend="ital">an original, sense;</hi>] <hi rend="ital">that which is constantly used according to its original application;</hi> or a name for <hi rend="ital">that whereby is meant what it was</hi> [<hi rend="ital">originally</hi>] <hi rend="ital">applied to denote;</hi> (TA;) <hi rend="ital">contr. of</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">مَجَازٌ</foreign>: (S, K:) of the measure <foreign lang="ar">فَعِيلَةٌ</foreign> in the sense of the measure <foreign lang="ar">فَاعِلَةٌ</foreign>, from <foreign lang="ar">حَقَّ الشَّىْءُ</foreign> signifying <foreign lang="ar">ثَبَتَ</foreign>: the <foreign lang="ar">ة</foreign> is affixed for the conversion of the word from an epithet to a subst.: (TA:) [pl. as above]. [It is also called <foreign lang="ar">حَقِيقَةٌ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">لُغَوِيَّةٌ</foreign>, and <foreign lang="ar">حَقِيقَةٌ لُغَةً</foreign>; to distinguish it from what is termed <foreign lang="ar">حَقِيقَةٌ عُرْفِيَّةٌ</foreign>, and <foreign lang="ar">حَقِيقَةٌ عُرْفًا</foreign>, which is <hi rend="ital">A word,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">phrase, so much used in a particular tropical sense as to be, in that sense, conventionally regarded as proper;</hi> as, for instance, <foreign lang="ar">عَدْلٌ</foreign> in the sense of “ just; ” it being properly an inf. n.] A <foreign lang="ar">مَجَاز</foreign>, when much used, becomes what is termed <foreign lang="ar">حَقِيقَةٌ عُرْفًا</foreign>. (Mz 24th <foreign lang="ar">نوع</foreign>.) [<foreign lang="ar">حَقِيقَةٌ</foreign> means also <hi rend="ital">A proper</hi> (opposed to a tropical) <hi rend="ital">signification.</hi>]       <sense type="A" n="3">-A3-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">الحَقِيقَةُ</foreign> also signifies <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">That which,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">those whom, it is necessary for one,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">it behooveth one, to defend,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">protect,</hi> (S, L, K, TA,) <hi rend="ital">of the people of one's house,</hi> (L,) or <hi rend="ital">such as the wife, and the female neighbour, and property, &amp;c.:</hi> (Ham p. 181:) pl. as above. (L.) You say, <foreign lang="ar">فُلَانٌ حَامِى الحَقِيقَةِ</foreign> <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  [<hi rend="ital">Such a one is the defender,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">protector, of that which,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">those whom, it is necessary,</hi> &amp;c., <hi rend="ital">to defend,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">protect</hi>]. (S, TA.) [See also <foreign lang="ar">ذِمَارٌ</foreign>. And see an ex. of this signification, or of the next, in a verse cited in p. 288.]          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  Also <assumedtropical>(assumed tropical:)</assumedtropical>  <hi rend="ital">The banner,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">standard:</hi> (S, K, and Ham ubi suprà:) this being included in the preceding meaning. (Ham.)          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  And <assumedtropical>(assumed tropical:)</assumedtropical>  <hi rend="ital">That which is sacred,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inviolable; that which one is under an obligation to respect,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">honour.</hi> (TA.)    </entryFree>28:T656c,<entryFree id="n8555" key="حَقَّ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <itype>1</itype>        
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">حَقَّ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">حق</orth>
                  </form>, aor.      
    <form n="infl">       
                     <orth orig="Bi" lang="ar" marker="Haqi3a">حَقِقَ</orth>
                  </form> (S, Msb, K, &amp;c.) and      
    <form n="infl">       
                     <orth orig="Bu" lang="ar" marker="Haqu3a">حَقُقَ</orth>
                  </form>, (IDrd, Msb, K,) [the latter irregular,] inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">حَقَّةٌ</foreign> (K, TA) and <foreign lang="ar">حَقٌّ</foreign> (IDrd, TA) and <foreign lang="ar">حُقُوقٌ</foreign>, (TA,) <hi rend="ital">i. q.</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">صَارَ حَقًّا</foreign> [i. e., accord. to the primary meaning of <foreign lang="ar">حَقٌّ</foreign>, as explained below, on the authority of Er-Rághib, <hi rend="ital">It was,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">became, suitable to the requirements of wisdom, justice, right</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rightness, truth,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reality</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fact;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to the exigencies of the case</hi>]: (TA:) <hi rend="ital">it was,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">became, just, proper, right, correct,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">true; authentic, genuine, sound, valid, substantial,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">real; established,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">confirmed, as a truth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fact:</hi> and <hi rend="ital">necessitated, necessary, requisite,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">unavoidable; binding, obligatory, incumbent,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">due:</hi> syn. <foreign lang="ar">وَجَبَ</foreign>; (T, S, Msb, K, &amp;c.;) and <foreign lang="ar">ثَبَتَ</foreign>: (Msb, TA:) <hi rend="ital">it was,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">became, a manifest and an indubitable fact</hi> or <hi rend="ital">event;</hi> as explained by IDrd in the Jm; (TA;) <hi rend="ital">it happened, betided,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">befell, surely, without doubt</hi> or <hi rend="ital">uncertainty.</hi> (K.) It is said in the Kur xxxvi. 6, <foreign lang="ar">لَقَدْ حَقَّ القَوْلُ عَلَى أَكْثَرِهِمْ</foreign>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">The saying,</hi> “ I will assuredly fill Hell with genii and men together, ” [Kur xi. 120 and xxxii. 13,] (Bd,) or <hi rend="ital">the sentence</hi> of punishment, (Jel,) <hi rend="ital">hath become necessitated</hi> [<hi rend="ital">as suitable to the requirements of justice,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">as being just</hi> or <hi rend="ital">right,</hi>] <hi rend="ital">to take effect upon the greater number of them;</hi> syn. <foreign lang="ar">وَجَبَ</foreign>, (Jel, TA,) and <foreign lang="ar">ثَبَتَ</foreign>. (TA.) And this, namely, <foreign lang="ar">ثَبَتَ</foreign>, is the meaning of the verb in the phrase, <foreign lang="ar">حَقَّ عَلَيْكَ القَضَآءُ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">The sentence was,</hi> or, emphatically, <hi rend="ital">is, necessitated as suitable to the requirements of justice to take effect upon thee;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">it was,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">is, necessary, just,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">right, that the sentence should take effect upon thee</hi>]. (TA.) [In like manner,] one says, <foreign lang="ar">يَحِقُّ عَلَيْكَ أَنْ تَفْعَلَ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">كَذَا</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">It is necessary for thee</hi> [<hi rend="ital">as suitable to the requirements of wisdom</hi> or <hi rend="ital">justice</hi> or <hi rend="ital">the like</hi>], or <hi rend="ital">incumbent on thee,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">just</hi> or <hi rend="ital">proper</hi> or <hi rend="ital">right for thee, that thou shouldst do such a thing.</hi> (TA.) [Thus one says,] <foreign lang="ar">الحَقِيقَةُ مَا يَحِقُّ عَلَيْكَ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">أَنْ تَحْمِيَهُ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">The</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">حقيقة</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">is that which it is necessary for thee</hi> &amp;c., or <hi rend="ital">that which it behooveth thee, that thou shouldst defend it,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">protect it</hi>]. (S, * K.) Accord. to Sh, the Arabs said, <foreign lang="ar">حَقَّ عَلَىَّ أَنْ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">أَفْعَلَ ذٰلِكَ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">حُقَّ</foreign>: but accord. to Fr, when you say <foreign lang="ar">حَقَّ</foreign>, you say <foreign lang="ar">عَلَيْكَ</foreign>; and when you say <foreign lang="ar">حُقَّ</foreign>, you say <foreign lang="ar">لَكَ</foreign>. (TA.) [Accordingly] one says, <foreign lang="ar">حُقَّ لَكَ أَنْ تَفْعَلَ ذَا</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">حُقِقْتَ أَنْ تَفْعَلَهُ</foreign>: both mean the same: (Ks, S, K:) [i. e., each has one, or the other, or both, of the meanings next following:] or the former means <hi rend="ital">It was,</hi> or, emphatically, <hi rend="ital">is, rendered</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">حّقّ</foreign> [or <hi rend="ital">suitable to the requirements of wisdom</hi> or <hi rend="ital">justice</hi> &amp;c.] <hi rend="ital">for thee,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">necessary for thee,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">incumbent on thee,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">just</hi> or <hi rend="ital">proper</hi> or <hi rend="ital">right for thee,</hi> [or <hi rend="ital">it behooved</hi> or <hi rend="ital">behooves thee,</hi>] <hi rend="ital">that thou shouldst do,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to do, this,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">that:</hi> and [the latter, or] <foreign lang="ar">حُقِقْتَ بِأَنْ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">تَفْعَلَ</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Thou wast,</hi> or, emphatically, <hi rend="ital">art, rendered</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">حَقِيق</foreign> [or <hi rend="ital">adapted, disposed, apt, meet, suited, suitable, fitted, fit, proper, competent,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">worthy,</hi>] <hi rend="ital">that thou shouldst do,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to do, this,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">that</hi>]: (A, TA:) and in like manner, <foreign lang="ar">حُقَّتْ</foreign> signifies in the Kur lxxxiv. 2 and 5: (Bd, Jel: *) or <foreign lang="ar">حُقِقْتَ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">بِأَنْ تَفْعَلَ</foreign> may mean <hi rend="ital">thou wast,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">art, known by the testimony of thy circumstances to be</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">حَقِيق</foreign> &amp;c. (A, TA.) And <foreign lang="ar">مَا كَانَ يَحُقُّكَ أَنْ تَفْعَلَهُ</foreign> 
                  <pb n="606"/> [virtually] means the same as <foreign lang="ar">مَا حُقَّ لَكَ</foreign> [best rendered in this case <hi rend="ital">It did not behoove thee to do it</hi>]. (TA.) One says also, <foreign lang="ar">حَقَّ أَنْ تَفْعَلَ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">It was,</hi> or, emphatically, <hi rend="ital">is, necessary</hi> &amp;c. <hi rend="ital">that thou shouldst do</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to do</hi> such a thing]: but they did not say, <foreign lang="ar">حَقَقْتَ أَنْ تَفْعَلَ</foreign>. (Fr, TA.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  But <foreign lang="ar">حَقَّ عَلَىَّ أَنْ تَفْعَلَ كَذَا</foreign> means <hi rend="ital">Thy doing so distressed,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hath distressed,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">afflicted, me;</hi> or, emphatically, <hi rend="ital">distresses,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">afflicts, me;</hi> like <foreign lang="ar">عَزَّ عَلَىَّ</foreign>. (S and K and TA in art. <foreign lang="ar">عز</foreign>.) And in like manner, <foreign lang="ar">حَقَّ أَنَّكَ ذَاهِبٌ</foreign> [or <foreign lang="ar">حَقَّ مَا أَنَّكَ ذَاهِبٌ</foreign>] means <foreign lang="ar">عَزَّ مَا أَنَّكَ ذَاهِبٌ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">It is distressing to me that thou art going away</hi>]. (TA in art. <foreign lang="ar">عز</foreign>.) And <foreign lang="ar">لَحَقَّ مَا</foreign> is used in the same manner as <foreign lang="ar">لَعَزَّ مَا</foreign>, q. v. (A and TA in art. <foreign lang="ar">عز</foreign>.) You say also, <foreign lang="ar">حَقَّتِ الحَاجَةُ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">Want befell,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">betided,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">happened, and was severe,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">distressing:</hi> (Msb, TA:) [which is said to be] from the phrase, <foreign lang="ar">حَقَّتِ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">القِيَامَةُ</foreign>, aor.      
    <form n="infl">       
                     <orth orig="Bu" lang="ar" marker="Haqu3a">حَقُقَ</orth>
                  </form>, <hi rend="ital">The resurrection included,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shall include, within its sphere</hi> [<hi rend="ital">all</hi>] <hi rend="ital">the created beings.</hi> (Msb.)       <sense type="A" n="2">-A2-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">حَقَّتْ</foreign>, aor.      
    <form n="infl">       
                     <orth orig="Bi" lang="ar" marker="Haqi3a">حَقِقَ</orth>
                  </form>, (K,) inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">حِقَّةٌ</foreign> (S, * Msb, K,) and <foreign lang="ar">حِقٌّ</foreign>, (K,) or, accord. to ISd, it should rather be <foreign lang="ar">حَقَاقَةٌ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">حُقُوقَةٌ</foreign>, because <foreign lang="ar">حِقَّةٌ</foreign> is used as an epithet, [as will be seen below,] and the inf. n. in a case like this, by rule, should differ from the epithet, (TA,) <hi rend="ital">She</hi> (a camel) <hi rend="ital">became a</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">حِقّ</foreign>, or <foreign lang="ar">حِقَّة</foreign>; i. e., <hi rend="ital">entered the fourth year:</hi> (K:) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8555-1" target="أَحَقَّ" n="1" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign>, inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">إِحْقَاقٌ</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">he</hi> (a camel) <hi rend="ital">became a</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">حِقّ</foreign>: because, so they say, he is then fit to be laden: (Msb:) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8555-2" target="احقّت" n="2" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">she</hi> (a young camel) <hi rend="ital">completed three years;</hi> (Aboo-Málik, K;) <hi rend="ital">became a</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">حِقَّة</foreign>; (Ibn-'Abbád, K;) like <foreign lang="ar">حَقَّتْ</foreign>. (TA.) You say, <foreign lang="ar">هُوَ حَقٌّ بَيِّنُ الحِقَّةِ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">He is a</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">حقّ</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">bearing evidence of being such</hi>]: (S:) and <foreign lang="ar">هِىَ حِقٌّ</foreign> (K) and <foreign lang="ar">حِقَّةٌ</foreign> (Msb, K) <foreign lang="ar">بَيِّنَةُ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">الحِقَّةِ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">she is a</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">حقّ</foreign> or <foreign lang="ar">حقّة</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">bearing evidence</hi> &amp;c.]: (Msb:) [a phrase] to which a parallel is scarcely known, (Msb,) or to which there is no parallel (K) except <foreign lang="ar">أَسَدٌ بَيِّنُ الأَسَدِ</foreign> [a lion bearing evidence of being like a lion in boldness]. (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">حِقٌّ</foreign> [as inf. n. of <foreign lang="ar">حَقَّتْ</foreign>] also signifies A she-camel's <hi rend="ital">overpassing the days</hi> [<hi rend="ital">corresponding to those</hi>] <hi rend="ital">in which she was covered</hi> [<hi rend="ital">in the preceding year</hi>]: (K:) or her <hi rend="ital">completing</hi> [<hi rend="ital">the time of</hi>] <hi rend="ital">her pregnancy;</hi> as also   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8555-3" target="اِسْتِحْقَاقٌ" n="3" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign>. (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  And <foreign lang="ar">حَقَّتْ</foreign> and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8555-4" target="احقّت" n="4" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign> and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8555-5" target="استحقّت" n="5" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">She</hi> (a camel) <hi rend="ital">became fat.</hi> (TA. [See also 8, last signification.])       <sense type="A" n="3">-A3-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">حَقَّهُ</foreign>, (K,) aor.      
    <form n="infl">       
                     <orth orig="Bu" lang="ar" marker="Haqu3a">حَقُقَ</orth>
                  </form>, inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">حَقٌّ</foreign>, (TA,) <hi rend="ital">He,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">it, rendered it</hi> [<hi rend="ital">suitable to the requirements of wisdom, justice, rightness, truth,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reality</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fact;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to the exigencies of the case;</hi> (see the first of the significations in this art.;) or] <hi rend="ital">necessary, requisite,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">unavoidable; binding, obligatory, incumbent,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">due;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">just, proper,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">right;</hi> syn. <foreign lang="ar">أَوْجَبَهُ</foreign>; (K;) [whence <foreign lang="ar">حُقَّ لَكَ أَنْ تَفْعَلَ ذَا</foreign>, explained above;] as also   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8555-6" target="حقّقهُ" n="6" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n8556"/></foreign> (K) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8555-7" target="احقّهُ" n="7" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign>; (S, K;) which last some explain by <foreign lang="ar">صَيَّرَهُ حَقًّا</foreign> [meaning as above; or <hi rend="ital">he rendered it true;</hi>] or <foreign lang="ar">صيّره حقًّا لَا شَكَّ فِيهِ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">he rendered it true, so that there was no doubt respecting it</hi>]; as also <foreign lang="ar">حَقَّهُ</foreign>, inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">حَقٌّ</foreign>: and <foreign lang="ar">حَقَّهُ</foreign> signifies also <hi rend="ital">he established it so that it became true and undoubted in his estimation:</hi> (TA:) or <foreign lang="ar">حَقَّهُ</foreign> signifies, (S, Msb,) or signifies also, (K,) <hi rend="ital">he assured,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">certified, himself of it; he ascertained it; he was,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">became, sure,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">certain, of it;</hi> (A 'Obeyd, S, Msb, * K; *) and so   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8555-8" target="تحقّقه" n="8" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign> (A 'Obeyd, S, K) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8555-9" target="احقّهُ" n="9" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign>: (S, Msb: *) or <hi rend="ital">he pronounced it,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">held</hi> or <hi rend="ital">believed it, to be established as a necessary truth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fact;</hi> as also   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8555-10" target="احقّهُ" n="10" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign>: and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8555-11" target="حقّقهُ" n="11" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n8556"/></foreign> has a similar, but intensive, signification: (Msb:) or   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8555-12" target="احقّهُ" n="12" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign> signifies <hi rend="ital">he established it as true;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">he judged,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">decided, it to be so:</hi> (TA: [<hi rend="ital">contr. of</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">أَبْطَلَهُ</foreign>: see an ex., from the Kur viii., voce <foreign lang="ar">أَبْطَلَ</foreign>:]) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8555-13" target="حقّقهُ" n="13" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n8556"/></foreign>, inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">تَحْقِيقٌ</foreign>, signifies <foreign lang="ar">صَدَّقَهُ</foreign> [as meaning <hi rend="ital">he verified it,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">proved it to be true</hi> or <hi rend="ital">veritable;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">he found it to be true</hi> or <hi rend="ital">veritable;</hi> both of which significations are of very frequent occurrence]; (S, K;) as also <foreign lang="ar">حَقَّهُ</foreign>, inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">حَقٌّ</foreign>: and accord. to IDrd,   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8555-14" target="حقّقهُ" n="14" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n8556"/></foreign> signifies [also] <foreign lang="ar">صَدَّقَ قَائِلَهُ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">he proved,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">found,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pronounced, the sayer of it to be ture</hi>]: and <foreign lang="ar">حقّق</foreign> is also said to signify <hi rend="ital">he said,</hi> “ <hi rend="ital">This thing is the truth;</hi> ” like <foreign lang="ar">صَدَّقَ</foreign>. (TA.) You say, <foreign lang="ar">حَقَقْتُ عَلَيْهِ القَضَآءَ</foreign>, aor.      
    <form n="infl">       
                     <orth orig="Bu" lang="ar" marker="Haqu3a">حَقُقَ</orth>
                  </form>, inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">حَقٌّ</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">I necessitated the sentence</hi> [<hi rend="ital">as suitable to the requirements of justice</hi>] <hi rend="ital">to take effect upon him;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">necessitated</hi> [<hi rend="ital">as suitable</hi> &amp;c.] <hi rend="ital">the taking effect of the sentence upon him;</hi> syn. <foreign lang="ar">أَوْجَبْتُهُ</foreign>; as also   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8555-15" target="أَحْقَقْتُهُ" n="15" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign>, inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">إِحْقَاقٌ</foreign>. (TA.) And   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8555-16" target="أُحِقَّ" n="16" lang="ar" type="7" subtype="WOTF"/> عَلَيْكَ القَضَآءُ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">The sentence was,</hi> or, emphatically, <hi rend="ital">is, necessitated</hi> [<hi rend="ital">as suitable to the requirements of justice</hi>] <hi rend="ital">to take effect upon thee;</hi> syn. <foreign lang="ar">أُثْبِتَ</foreign>. (TA.) And <foreign lang="ar">حَقَقْتُ حَذَرَهُ</foreign>, (S, K,) or <foreign lang="ar">حِذْرَهُ</foreign>, (so in one copy of the S,) aor. and inf. n. as above, (S,) [<hi rend="ital">I rendered his caution,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fear, necessary;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">justified it;</hi> meaning] <hi rend="ital">I did that of which he was cautious,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">that which he feared;</hi> (S, K;) as also <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8555-17" target="أَحْقَقْتُ" n="17" type="5" subtype="FSO" lang="ar"/>حذره</foreign>: (S:) or, accord. to Az, the latter only is right. (TA.) And <foreign lang="ar">حَقَقْتُ ظَنَّهُ</foreign>; (Ks, TA;) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8555-18" target="حَقَّقْتُهُ" n="18" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign>, (Ks, S, TA,) inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">تَحْقِيقٌ</foreign>: (S:) both signify the same; (Ks, TA;) i. e. <foreign lang="ar">صَدَّقْتُ</foreign>; (S;) which means <hi rend="ital">I found his opinion to be true;</hi> (Ksh and Bd and Jel, in xxxiv. 19;) or <hi rend="ital">proved it to be true:</hi> (Ksh, ibid.:) and so <foreign lang="ar">قَوْلَهُ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">his saying:</hi> (S:) and <foreign lang="ar">تَحْقِيقٌ</foreign> signifies [also] the <hi rend="ital">strengthening,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">confirming,</hi> a saying; or <hi rend="ital">making</hi> it <hi rend="ital">strong,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">firm.</hi> (KL.) And <foreign lang="ar">أَنَا</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">أَحَقُّ لَكُمْ هٰذَا الخَبَرَ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">I will know,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ascertain, the truth,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">real nature, of this piece of news</hi> or <hi rend="ital">information, for you.</hi> (TA.) And <foreign lang="ar">أَظُنُّهُ وَ لَا</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">أَحُقُّهُ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">I think it, but I do not know the truth of it,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">am not certain of it</hi>]. (T in art. <foreign lang="ar">إِيَّا</foreign>; &amp;c.) And <foreign lang="ar">حَقَقْتُ العُقْدَةَ</foreign>, [written in the TA without any syll. signs, so that it may be either thus or   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8555-19" target="حَقَّقْتُهُ" n="19" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign>; but it is most probably the former, as the quasi-pass. is not <foreign lang="ar">تحقّقت</foreign>, but <foreign lang="ar">انحقّت</foreign>: it signifies lit. <hi rend="ital">I made the knot right,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sure;</hi> meaning] <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">I tied,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">made fast,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tightened, the knot;</hi> (Ibn-'Abbád, TA;) or <hi rend="ital">I tied,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tightened, firmly the knot.</hi> (A, TA.)           <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  [<hi rend="ital">He,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">it, rendered him</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">حَقِيق</foreign>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">adapted, disposed, apt, meet, suited, suitable, fitted, fit, proper,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">worthy,</hi> to do a thing &amp;c.; whence <foreign lang="ar">حُقِقْتَ أَنْ تَفْعَلَهُ</foreign>, or <foreign lang="ar">بِأَنْ تَفْعَلَ</foreign>, explained above.          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  <hi rend="ital">It was necessary for him,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">incumbent on him,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">just</hi> or <hi rend="ital">proper</hi> or <hi rend="ital">right for him,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">it behooved him,</hi> to do a thing &amp;c.; whence <foreign lang="ar">مَا</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">كَانَ يَحُقُّكَ أَنْ تَفْعَلَهُ</foreign>, explained above.]          <sense type="b" n="4">-b4-</sense>  Also, (S, K,) aor.

                     <orth orig="Bu" lang="ar" marker="Haqu3a">حَقُقَ</orth>
                  </form>, (K,) inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">حَقٌّ</foreign>, (TA,) <hi rend="ital">He overcame him in disputing,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">contending, for a right,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">due;</hi> (S, K, * TA;) and so

                     <itype>3</itype>

                  </form>, (S, K,) inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">حِقَاقٌ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">مُحَاقَّةٌ</foreign>, (TA,) <hi rend="ital">He disputed, litigated,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">contended, with him,</hi> (S, K,) <hi rend="ital">each of them laying claim to a right,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">due:</hi> (S, TA:) the verb is mostly used in the third person. (TA.) You say, <foreign lang="ar">حَاقَّنِى وَ لَمْ يُحَاقَّنِى</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">فِيهِ أَحَدٌ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">He disputed,</hi> &amp;c., <hi rend="ital">with me, and no one had disputed,</hi> &amp;c., <hi rend="ital">with me respecting it</hi>]. (TA.) [But] you say also,   
      <foreign lang="ar">حَاقَقْتُهُ <ref cref="n8557-1" target="فَحَقَقْتُهُ" n="1" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">I disputed, litigated,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">contended, with him for a right,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">due, and I overcame him in doing so.</hi> (TA.) And <foreign lang="ar">إِنَّهُ لَنَزِقُ الحِقَاقِ</foreign> <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">Verily he is one who disputes,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">litigates,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">contends, respecting small things.</hi> (S, K, TA.) And <foreign lang="ar">مَا لَهُ فِيهِ حَقٌّ وَ لَا حِقَاقٌ</foreign>, i. e. [<hi rend="ital">He has no right,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">due,</hi> to exact, <hi rend="ital">in respect of him,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">it, nor any</hi> cause of] <hi rend="ital">disputing,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">litigating,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">contending.</hi> (S.) And it is said respecting women, (K,) in a trad. of 'Alee, (TA,) <foreign lang="ar">إِذَا بَلَغْنَ نَصَّ الحِقَاقِ فَالعَصَبَةُ أَوْلَى</foreign>, or <foreign lang="ar">الحَقَائِقِ</foreign>: (K:) accord. to some, <foreign lang="ar">الحقاق</foreign> here means the same as <foreign lang="ar">المُحَاقَّة</foreign>: accord. to others, it properly signifies the camels thus called: and so <foreign lang="ar">الحقائق</foreign>; <pb n="607"/> this [likewise] being a pl. of   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8557-2" target="حِقَّةٌ" n="2" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n8569"/></foreign>; or it is pl. of   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8557-3" target="حَقِيقَةٌ" n="3" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n8573"/></foreign>. (TA. [See art. <foreign lang="ar">نص</foreign>; in which this trad. is more fully, but somewhat differently, cited; and fully explained.])       <sense type="A" n="2">-A2-</sense>  [Also, app., <hi rend="ital">He acted seriously,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in earnest, with him</hi> in an affair: see 3 in art. <foreign lang="ar">جد</foreign>: and see also 2 above, last signification.]    </entryFree>2b:Tc3f,<entryFree id="n8558" key="احقّ" type="main">

                  <form>       
                     <itype>6</itype>        
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">تَحَاقٌّ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">أحاق</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">حاق</orth>

                  </form> is syn. with <foreign lang="ar">تَخَاصُمٌ</foreign>; and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8560-1" target="اِحْتِقَاقٌ" n="1" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign>, with <foreign lang="ar">اِخْتِصَامٌ</foreign>; [The <hi rend="ital">disputing, litigating,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">contending, together;</hi>] (S, K;) [for] <foreign lang="ar">تَخَاصَمُوا</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">اِخْتَصَمُوا</foreign> signify the same; (K in art. <foreign lang="ar">خصم</foreign>;) [or rather] the meaning of [<foreign lang="ar">تحاقّ</foreign> and]   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8560-2" target="احتقاق" n="2" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign> is [the <hi rend="ital">disputing,</hi> &amp;c., <hi rend="ital">together for a right,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">due;</hi>] <hi rend="ital">each one's,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">every one's, saying,</hi> “ The <hi rend="ital">right is mine,</hi> ” and “ <hi rend="ital">with me;</hi> ” or <hi rend="ital">demanding his right,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">due.</hi> (TA.)       <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8560-3" target="اِحْتَقَّا" n="3" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign>

And <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8560-4" target="احتقّ" n="4" type="5" subtype="FSO" lang="ar"/>فُلَانٌ وَ فُلَانٌ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">Such a one and such a one disputed,</hi> &amp;c., <hi rend="ital">together for a right,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">due</hi>]. (S.) One does not say of a single person [<foreign lang="ar">تحاقّ</foreign> nor]   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8560-5" target="احتقّ" n="5" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign>; like as one does not say of one only [<foreign lang="ar">تخاصم</foreign> nor] <foreign lang="ar">اختصم</foreign>. (S.)    </entryFree>2e:Ta7e,<entryFree id="n8561-7" key="إِحْتَقَقَ">     
                  <form>       
                     <itype>8</itype>        
                     <orth lang="ar" marker="none">إِحْتَقَقَ</orth>
                  </form> see 6, throughout.       <sense type="A" n="2">-A2-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">اِحْتَقَّتْ بِهِ الطَّعْنَةُ</foreign> <assumedtropical>(assumed tropical:)</assumedtropical>  <hi rend="ital">The thrust,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">piercing, killed him:</hi> (AA, K:) or <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">went right,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">directly, into him:</hi> (As, TA:) or <assumedtropical>(assumed tropical:)</assumedtropical>  <hi rend="ital">penetrated into his belly,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inside:</hi> (L, TA:) or <hi rend="ital">hit,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">struck, the socket,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">turning-place, of his hip, which is termed its</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">حُقّ</foreign>. (K, * TA.) One says, <foreign lang="ar">رَمَى فُلَانٌ الصَّيْدَ فَٱحْتَقَّ بَعْضًا وَ شَرَّمَ بَعْضًا</foreign> <assumedtropical>(assumed tropical:)</assumedtropical>  <hi rend="ital">Such a one shot,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cast, at the objects of the chase, and killed some, and wounded some so that they escaped:</hi> (S:) or <hi rend="ital">pierced into the bellies,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">insides, of some, and wounded the skin of some without so piercing.</hi> (L.)       <sense type="A" n="3">-A3-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">احتقّهُ إِلَى كَذَا</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He kept him,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">held him, back,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">retarded him,</hi> [<hi rend="ital">until such a time,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">such an event,</hi>] <hi rend="ital">and straitened him.</hi> (TA.)       <sense type="A" n="4">-A4-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">احتقّ الفَرَسُ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">The horse became lean,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">light of flesh;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">slender, and lean;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lean, and lank in the belly.</hi> (S, K, TA.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  And <foreign lang="ar">احتقّ المَالُ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">The cattle became fat:</hi> (K: [see also the last meaning of 1 as an intrans. verb:]) but in the A and O and L, <foreign lang="ar">احتقّ القَوْمُ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">the people's cattle became fat, and their fatness ended,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">attained the extreme point.</hi> (TA.)    </entryFree>2f:T1036,<entryFree id="n8562" key="استحقّهُ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <itype>10</itype>        
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">استحقّهُ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">أستحقه</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">استحقه</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">استحقة</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ٱستحق</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ٱستحقه</orth>
                  </form> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He demanded it as his right,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">due.</hi> (TA.) [And hence,] <hi rend="ital">He had a right,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">just title</hi> or <hi rend="ital">claim, to it; he was,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">became, entitled to it; he deserved it,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">merited it;</hi> syn. <foreign lang="ar">اِسْتَوْجَبَهُ</foreign>: (S, Msb, K:) or these two verbs are nearly the same; (TA;) [the former meaning <hi rend="ital">he was,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">became, adapted, disposed, apt, meet, suited, suitable, fitted, fit, competent,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">proper, for it;</hi> which is the most proper meaning of the phrase <foreign lang="ar">صَارَ حَقِيقًا بِهِ</foreign>, as well as of the verb <foreign lang="ar">استحقّ</foreign>; but this verb has also the former of these two meanings.] When a man purchases a house, and another lays claim to it, and establishes a just evidence of his claim, and the judge decides for him according to his evidence, one says of him, <foreign lang="ar">قَدِ ٱسْتَحَقَّهَا عَلَى المُشْتَرِى</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">He has a right to it in preference to the purchaser</hi>]; meaning that he is to possess it in preference to the purchaser. (TA.) And of a camel such as is termed <foreign lang="ar">حِقّ</foreign> one says, <foreign lang="ar">استحقّ أَنْ يُرْكَبَ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">He was,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">has become, fit to be ridden</hi>], (K,) and <foreign lang="ar">أَنْ يُحْمَلَ عَلَيْهِ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">to be laden</hi>]: (S, Msb:) and <foreign lang="ar">استحقّ الضِّرَابَ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">He was,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">has become, fit for covering</hi>]. (L, K.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  [Hence, <hi rend="ital">It</hi> (an action, and anything,) <hi rend="ital">deserved it, merited it,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">required it.</hi>] And <foreign lang="ar">استحقّ إِثْمًا</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He did what necessitated sin;</hi> (Ksh and Bd and Jel in v. 106;) [<hi rend="ital">was guilty of a sin;</hi>] and <hi rend="ital">deserved its being said of him that he was a sinner;</hi> (Ksh ibid.;) <hi rend="ital">i. q.</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">اِسْتَوْجَبَهُ</foreign>. (TA.) And <foreign lang="ar">استحقّوا</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">They committed sins for which he who should punish them would be excusable, because they deserved punishment;</hi> like <foreign lang="ar">أَوْجَبُوا</foreign>, and <foreign lang="ar">أَعْذَرُوا</foreign>, and <foreign lang="ar">اِسْتَلَاطُوا</foreign>. (IAar, TA in art. <foreign lang="ar">لوط</foreign>.)          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">استحقّت</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">إِبِلُنَا رَبِيعًا</foreign>: see 4, last sentence.          <sense type="b" n="4">-b4-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">استحقّت النَّاقَةُ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">لَقَاحًا</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">The she-camel conceived,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">became pregnant;</hi> and <foreign lang="ar">استحقّ لَقَاحُهَا</foreign> [signifies the same]. (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="5">-b5-</sense>  See also 1, as an intrans. verb, last two sentences.    </entryFree>30:Tae9,<entryFree id="n8563" key="حَقْحَقَ" type="main">     
                  <form type="R Q">       
                     <itype>R. Q. 1</itype>        
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">حَقْحَقَ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">حقحق</orth>
                  </form>, inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">حَقْحَقَةٌ</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">He went the pace,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in the manner, termed</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">حَقْحَقَةٌ</foreign>; (TA;) which means <hi rend="ital">a pace,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">manner of going, in which the beast is made to exert himself to the very utmost, and which is the most fatiguing to the</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">ظَهْر</foreign> [meaning the <hi rend="ital">camel that is ridden,</hi> or the <hi rend="ital">beast that carries one</hi>]: (S, Mgh, K:) or <hi rend="ital">a journeying in the beginning,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">first part, of the night;</hi> (Lth, S, K;) which is forbidden: (Lth, S, TA:) or, as some say, the <hi rend="ital">fatiguing a while, and abstaining a while:</hi> (Lth, TA:) but Az says that Lth is not correct in either of his explanations of this word: (TA:) or <hi rend="ital">an obstinate persisting in journeying:</hi> or <hi rend="ital">an obstinate persisting in journeying until the camel that one is riding perishes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">breaks down:</hi> (K:) or, accord. to Az, the correct meaning, confirmed by what the Arabs said, is the <hi rend="ital">making the camel to go on, and urging him to that which fatigues him, and that which is beyond his power, until he breaks down with his rider:</hi> or, accord. to IAar, the <hi rend="ital">jading of the weak</hi> [<hi rend="ital">beast</hi>] <hi rend="ital">by hard journeying.</hi> (TA.) It is related in a trad., that Mutarrif Ibn-Esh-Shikhkheer said to his son, when he took extraordinary pains in religious exercises, (S, TA,) and was immoderate therein, (TA,) <foreign lang="ar">خَيْرُ الأُمُورِ أَوْسَاطُهَا وَ الحَسَنَةُ بَيْنَ الشَّيْئَيْنِ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">وَ شَرُّ السَّيْرِ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">The best of affairs,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">actions,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cases, are such of them as are between two extremes; and the good action is between the two things; and the worst kind of journeying is that in which the beast is made to exert himself to the very utmost,</hi> &amp;c.]: (S, TA:) meaning, pursue thou the middle course in religious exercises, and burden not thyself, lest thou become disgusted; for the best of works is that which is continued, though it be small. (TA.)    </entryFree>31:T357a,<entryFree id="n8564" key="حَقٌّ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">حَقٌّ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">حق</orth>
                  </form> 
                  <hi rend="ital">contr. of</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">بَاطِلٌ</foreign> [used as a subst. and as an epithet or act. part. n.]: (S, Msb, K:) or, as an inf. n. [and used as a simple subst.], <hi rend="ital">contr. of</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">بُطْلَانٌ</foreign>; and as an act. part. n., and a simple epithet, <hi rend="ital">contr. of</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">بَاطِلٌ</foreign>. (Kull.) [As a subst.,] its primary signification is <hi rend="ital">Suitableness to the requirements of wisdom, justice, right,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rightness, truth, reality,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fact;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to the exigencies of the case;</hi> as the suitableness of the foot of a door in respect of its socket, for turning round rightly: (Er-Rághib, TA:) [and particularly] the <hi rend="ital">suitableness</hi> of a judgment, and of what involves, or implies, a judgment, [i. e., of a saying, and a religion, and a persuasion, or the like, (as will be shown by one of the explanations of its meanings as an epithet,)] <hi rend="ital">to reality</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fact;</hi> and the <hi rend="ital">suitableness</hi> of reality or fact <hi rend="ital">to a judgment:</hi> (Kull:) [the <hi rend="ital">state,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">quality,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">property, of being just, proper, right, correct,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">true; justness, propriety, rightness, correctness,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">truth; reality,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fact;</hi> the <hi rend="ital">state,</hi> &amp;c., <hi rend="ital">of being established,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">confirmed, as a truth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fact; of being necessary, requisite,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">unavoidable; of being binding, obligatory, incumbent,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">due:</hi> (as shown above: see 1, first sentence:)] and <hi rend="ital">existence</hi> in relation to substances, absolutely: and <hi rend="ital">everlasting existence</hi> [in relation to God]: (Kull:) pl. <foreign lang="ar">حُقُوقٌ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">حِقَاقٌ</foreign>: it has no pl. of pauc. (TA.) As an act. part. n. and a simple epithet, it is applied to a judgment [as meaning] <hi rend="ital">suitable to reality</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fact;</hi> and to a saying, and a religion, and a persuasion, considered as involving, or implying, such a judgment: (Kull:) to that which is <hi rend="ital">suitable to the requirements of wisdom, justice, right,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rightness;</hi> as when one says that every act of God is <foreign lang="ar">حَقّ</foreign>: to a belief, in a thing, <hi rend="ital">suitable to the reality of the case;</hi> as when one says that belief in the resurrection is <foreign lang="ar">حَقّ</foreign>: and to an action, and a saying, <hi rend="ital">accordant to what is requisite</hi> or <hi rend="ital">obligatory, in quality and measure and time;</hi> as when one says that the action of another is <foreign lang="ar">حَقّ</foreign>, and that his saying is <foreign lang="ar">حَقّ</foreign>: (Er-Rághib, TA:) [thus it signifies <hi rend="ital">just, proper, right, correct,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">true; authentic, genuine, sound,</hi> 
                  <pb n="608"/> 
                  <hi rend="ital">valid, substantial,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">real; established,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">confirmed, as a truth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fact:</hi> and <hi rend="ital">necessary, requisite,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">unavoidable:</hi> and <hi rend="ital">binding, obligatory, incumbent,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">due:</hi>] also the <hi rend="ital">necessarily-existing by his own essence</hi> [applied to God; as an epithet of Whom it has other meanings assigned to it by some, as will be seen below]: and anything <hi rend="ital">existing,</hi> of an objective kind: (Kull:) <hi rend="ital">existing as an established fact,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">truth,</hi> (K, TA,) <hi rend="ital">so as to be undeniable.</hi> (TA.) In the saying, <foreign lang="ar">هٰذَا عَبْدُ ٱللّٰهِ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">الحَقَّ لَا البَاطِلَ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">This is 'Abd-Allah, truly; not falsely</hi>], the article <foreign lang="ar">ال</foreign> is prefixed as it is in the phrase, <foreign lang="ar">أَرْسَلَهَا العِرَاكَ</foreign>; but sometimes it is dropped, so that one says <foreign lang="ar">حَقًّا لَا بَاطِلًا</foreign>. (Sb, TA.) And in the phrase, <foreign lang="ar">لَحَقُّ لَا آتِيكَ</foreign>, a form of oath, the nom. case is used without tenween; but when the <foreign lang="ar">ل</foreign> is dropped, one says, <foreign lang="ar">حَقًّا لَا آتِيكَ</foreign>: (S, TA:) [the latter means <hi rend="ital">Truly I will not come to thee:</hi> the former seems to be best explained by what here follows:] accord. to the A, <foreign lang="ar">لَحَقُّ لَا أَفْعَلُ</foreign> is originally <foreign lang="ar">لَحَقُّ ٱللّٰهِ لَا أَفْعَلُ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">The truth,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">existence, of God</hi> is that by which I swear, <hi rend="ital">I will not do</hi> such a thing]; the affixed noun [<foreign lang="ar">اللّٰه</foreign>] being suppressed, and meant to be understood. (TA.) <foreign lang="ar">الحَقُّ بِيَدِى</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">The right is mine</hi>] and <foreign lang="ar">الحَقُّ مَعِى</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">The right is with me</hi> and <foreign lang="ar">الحَقُّ عَلَيْكَ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">The right is against thee,</hi> which last is often used as meaning <hi rend="ital">thou art in fault,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in the wrong,</hi>] are said by one disputing, or contending, for a thing. (TA.) [And in like manner one says <foreign lang="ar">الحَقُّ بِيَدِكَ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">مَعَكَ</foreign> as meaning <hi rend="ital">Thou art in the right,</hi> and <foreign lang="ar">الحَقُّ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">عَلَىَّ</foreign> as meaning <hi rend="ital">I am in the wrong.</hi>] One says also, <foreign lang="ar">كَانَ ذٰلِكَ عِنْدَ حَقِّ لَقَاحِهَا</foreign>, and <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8564-1" target="حِقِّ" n="1" type="5" subtype="FSO" lang="ar"/>لَقَاحِهَا</foreign> <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">That was on the occasion of the establishment of the fact of her conception,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pregnancy.</hi> (S, A, K, * TA.) And <foreign lang="ar">هٰذَا العَالِمُ حَقَّ العَالِمِ</foreign>, [like <foreign lang="ar">هٰذَا العَالِمُ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">جِدَّ العَالِمِ</foreign>,] <hi rend="ital">This is the learned</hi> man, <hi rend="ital">the extremely learned</hi> man. (Sb, TA.) And <foreign lang="ar">حَقُّ عَلِيمٍ</foreign> means <hi rend="ital">Very</hi> [or <hi rend="ital">extremely</hi>] <hi rend="ital">knowing.</hi> (Ham p. 139.) [Respecting the expressions <foreign lang="ar">الحَقُّ اليَقِينُ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">حَقُّ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">اليَقِينِ</foreign>, see art. <foreign lang="ar">يقن</foreign>.]          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  [From the primary and general signification, explained in the first sentence of this paragraph, are deduced several particular meanings here following.]          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  <hi rend="ital">Equity,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">justice.</hi> (K.)          <sense type="b" n="4">-b4-</sense>  [The <hi rend="ital">right mode,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">manner, of acting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">being.</hi>]          <sense type="b" n="5">-b5-</sense>  <hi rend="ital">Veracity</hi> (K) <hi rend="ital">in discourse.</hi> (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="6">-b6-</sense>  <hi rend="ital">Prudence.</hi> (K, TA.)          <sense type="b" n="7">-b7-</sense>  [<hi rend="ital">A right,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">due, of any kind: a just claim: a desert,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing deserved: anything that is owed;</hi> as <hi rend="ital">a fee, hire,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pay,</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a price: a duty; an obligation:</hi>] the sing. of <foreign lang="ar">حُقُوقٌ</foreign>. (S, K.) [You say, <foreign lang="ar">هٰذَا حَقِّى</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">This is my right,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">due,</hi> &amp;c. And <foreign lang="ar">هٰذَا حَقٌّ لِى</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">This is a right,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">due, belonging to me;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a thing due,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">owed, to me:</hi> or <hi rend="ital">this is a duty to me.</hi> And <foreign lang="ar">هٰذَا حَقٌّ عَلَىَّ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">This is a right,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">due, the rendering of which is binding, obligatory,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">incumbent, on me:</hi> or <hi rend="ital">this is my duty.</hi> And hence, <foreign lang="ar">حَقُّ الطَّرِيقِ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">The duty that relates to the road:</hi> see art. <foreign lang="ar">طرق</foreign>.]   
      <anchor/><foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8564-2" target="حَقَّةٌ" n="2" type="2" subtype="FPO" lang="ar" select="n8567"/></foreign> is a more particular, or peculiar, or special, term. (S, K.) You say,   
      <foreign lang="ar">هٰذِهِ <ref cref="n8564-3" target="حَقَّتِى" n="3" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign> [<hi rend="ital">This is my particular,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">peculiar,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">special, right</hi> or <hi rend="ital">due</hi> &amp;c.: but it is explained as] meaning <foreign lang="ar">حَقِّى</foreign>. (S.) And   
      <foreign lang="ar">هٰذِهِ <ref cref="n8564-4" target="حِقَّتِى" n="4" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">This is my just,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">necessary,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">incumbent, right</hi> or <hi rend="ital">due</hi> &amp;c. (K.)          <sense type="b" n="8">-b8-</sense>  <hi rend="ital">A share,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">portion;</hi> as in the saying, <foreign lang="ar">أَعْطِ كُلَّ ذِى حَقٍّ حَقَّهُ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">Give thou to every one to whom belongs a share,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">portion, his share,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">portion, that is appointed,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">assigned, to him.</hi> (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="9">-b9-</sense>  <hi rend="ital">Property: a possession.</hi> (K.)          <sense type="b" n="10">-b10-</sense>  [<hi rend="ital">An appertenance.</hi> Hence the pl.] <foreign lang="ar">حُقُوقٌ</foreign> signifies The <foreign lang="ar">مَرَافِق</foreign> [or <hi rend="ital">appertenances,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conveniences, such as the privy and the kitchen and the like,</hi>] of a house. (Msb, TA.)          <sense type="b" n="11">-b11-</sense>  [<hi rend="ital">A necessary,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">requisite, thing.</hi>]          <sense type="b" n="12">-b12-</sense>  <hi rend="ital">A thing,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">an event, that is decreed,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">destined.</hi> (K, TA.) It is said to have this meaning in the Kur [xv. 8], in the words, <foreign lang="ar">مَا نُنَزِّلُ المَلَائِكَةَ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">إِلَّا بِالحَقِّ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">We send not down the angels save with that which is decreed,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">destined</hi>]: (TA:) or, as some say, it means here <hi rend="ital">revelation:</hi> (Ksh, Bd:) or <hi rend="ital">punishment.</hi> (Ksh, Bd, Jel.)          <sense type="b" n="13">-b13-</sense>  [And hence,] <hi rend="ital">Death.</hi> (K.) So accord. to some in the Kur [1. 18], where it is said, <foreign lang="ar">وَ جَآءَتْ سَكْرَةُ المَوْتِ بِالحَقِّ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">And the confusion of the intellect by reason of the agony of death shall come with death:</hi> but other and obvious meanings are assigned to it in this instance]. (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="14">-b14-</sense>  [As an epithet,] <foreign lang="ar">الحَقُّ</foreign> is one of the names of <hi rend="ital">God:</hi> or one of the epithets applied to Him: (K:) meaning <hi rend="ital">the Really-existing; whose existence and divinity are proved to be true:</hi> (IAth, TA:) or <hi rend="ital">the Creator according to the requirements of wisdom, justice, right,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rightness.</hi> (Er-Rághib, TA.)          <sense type="b" n="15">-b15-</sense>  It is also applied to <hi rend="ital">The Kur-án.</hi> (K.)          <sense type="b" n="16">-b16-</sense>  And to [<hi rend="ital">The religion of</hi>] <hi rend="ital">El-Islám.</hi> (K.)       <sense type="A" n="2">-A2-</sense>  See also <foreign lang="ar">حَقِيقٌ</foreign>, in two places.       <sense type="A" n="3">-A3-</sense>  And see <foreign lang="ar">حَاقٌّ</foreign>, in two places.    </entryFree>32:T7f7,<entryFree id="n8565" key="حُقٌّ" type="main">

                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">حُقٌّ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">حق</orth>
                  </form>: see <foreign lang="ar">حُقَّةٌ</foreign>.          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  Also The <hi rend="ital">breast,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mamma,</hi> of an old woman. (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  <hi rend="ital">A tuber</hi> of a truffle. (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="4">-b4-</sense>  The <hi rend="ital">small hollow upon the head</hi> of the shoulder-blade: (K:) or, as some say, the <foreign lang="ar">حُقّ</foreign> of the shoulder-blade is the <hi rend="ital">head of the upper arm, in which is the</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">وَابِلَة</foreign>: (TA:) or this latter is another signification of <foreign lang="ar">حُقّ</foreign>. (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="6">-b6-</sense>  The <hi rend="ital">socket,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">turning-place, of the foot</hi> of a door. (TA.) You say, <foreign lang="ar">لَقِيتُهُ عِنْدَ حُقِّ بَابِ المَسْجِدِ</foreign>, meaning <hi rend="ital">I met him,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">found him, near to the mosque:</hi> and <foreign lang="ar">لَقِيتُهُ مِنْ <ref cref="n8565-1" target="حَاقِّ" n="1" type="5" subtype="FSO" lang="ar"/>المَسْجِدِ</foreign> [app. means the same]. (Az, K.)    </entryFree>33:Tf2c,<entryFree id="n8566" key="حِقٌّ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">حِقٌّ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">حق</orth>
                  </form> A camel <hi rend="ital">three years old,</hi> (S, Mgh,) <hi rend="ital">that has entered the fourth year:</hi> (S, Mgh, Msb:) or a camel <hi rend="ital">entering the fourth year:</hi> (K:) so called because fit to be laden (S, Msb) and made use of; (S;) or because fit to be ridden; or because fit for covering: (K:) the female is termed   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8566-1" target="حِقَّةٌ" n="1" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n8569"/></foreign>, (S, Mgh, Msb, K,) and <foreign lang="ar">حِقٌّ</foreign> also: (S, K:) the pl. (of <foreign lang="ar">حِقٌّ</foreign>, Msb) is <foreign lang="ar">حِقَاقٌ</foreign> (S, Mgh, Msb, K) and (of <foreign lang="ar">حِقَّةٌ</foreign>, Msb) <foreign lang="ar">حِقَقٌ</foreign>, (Msb, K,) and the pl. pl., (K,) i. e. pl. of <foreign lang="ar">حِقَاقٌ</foreign>, (S,) is <foreign lang="ar">حُقُقٌ</foreign>, (S, K,) and sometimes <foreign lang="ar">حَقَائِقُ</foreign>, (S, TA,) or this is a pl. of <foreign lang="ar">حِقَّةٌ</foreign>. (TA: see 3.) Or [so in the K, but it should rather be “ and, ”] <foreign lang="ar">حِقٌّ</foreign> signifies A she-camel <hi rend="ital">whose teeth have fallen out by reason of extreme age.</hi> (K.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  One says, <foreign lang="ar">رَأَيْتَهَا وَ هِىَ حِقَّةٌ</foreign> as meaning <assumedtropical>(assumed tropical:)</assumedtropical>  [<hi rend="ital">I saw her when she was</hi>] <hi rend="ital">like a she-camel termed</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">حقّة</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">in bigness.</hi> (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  And [the pl.] <foreign lang="ar">حِقَاقٌ</foreign> is applied to The <hi rend="ital">young ones</hi> of trees: (TA:) and particularly of the [species of mimosa termed] <foreign lang="ar">عُرْفُط</foreign>: (K, TA:) as being likened to the camels termed <foreign lang="ar">حقاق</foreign>. (TA.)       <sense type="A" n="2">-A2-</sense>  Also <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  The <hi rend="ital">time of year in which a she-camel was covered in the preceding year;</hi> (S, TA;) and so   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8566-2" target="حِقَّةٌ" n="2" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n8569"/></foreign>: (TA:) or the <hi rend="ital">usual period of</hi> her <hi rend="ital">gestation.</hi> (L in art. <foreign lang="ar">نضج</foreign>.) You say, <foreign lang="ar">أَتَتِ النَّاقَةُ عَلَى حِقِّهَا</foreign> <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">The she-camel arrived at the time of year in which she had been covered in the preceding year:</hi> (S, TA:) and   
      <foreign lang="ar">اتت على <ref cref="n8566-3" target="حِقَّتِهَا" n="3" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign> signifies the same; or <hi rend="ital">she completed her period of gestation, and overpassed by some days the time of year in which she had been covered in the preceding year, to complete the formation of the fœtus.</hi> (TA.) And <foreign lang="ar">جَازَتِ الحِقَّ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">She</hi> (a camel) <hi rend="ital">overpassed the year without bringing forth.</hi> (As, S.) [See also the last sentence but one in the explanations of 1 as an intrans. verb.]          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">كَانَ ذٰلِكَ عِنْدَ حِقِّ لَقَاحِهَا</foreign>: see <foreign lang="ar">حَقٌّ</foreign>

                  <form>

                  <hi rend="ital">A receptacle of wood,</hi> (K, TA,) or <hi rend="ital">of ivory,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">of some other material proper to be cut,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shaped out;</hi> (TA;) <hi rend="ital">a receptacle for perfume;</hi> (Har p. 518;) [generally <hi rend="ital">a small round box,</hi> used for unguents and perfumes &amp;c.; and applied also to <hi rend="ital">a small cocoa-nut used as a box</hi> for snuff &amp;c.;] <hi rend="ital">a thing well known:</hi> (S:) [also <hi rend="ital">a receptacle for wine:</hi> (see <foreign lang="ar">تَأْمُورٌ</foreign>, in art. <foreign lang="ar">امر</foreign>:)] pl.

                  <form>       
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">حَقِيقٌ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">حقيق</orth>
                  </form> 
                  <hi rend="ital">Adapted, disposed, apt, meet, suited, suitable, fitted, fit, proper, competent,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">worthy;</hi> syn. <foreign lang="ar">خَلِيقٌ</foreign>, (Sh, S, Mgh, Msb, K,) and <foreign lang="ar">جَدِيرٌ</foreign>; (K;) as also   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8572-1" target="حَقٌّ" n="1" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n8564"/></foreign>, (Ibn- 'Abbád, K,) and [some say]   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8572-2" target="مَحْقُوقٌ" n="2" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n8583"/></foreign>: (Sh, S, Mgh, K:) <foreign lang="ar">حَقِيقٌ</foreign> is said to be of the measure <foreign lang="ar">فَعِيلٌ</foreign> in the sense of the <pb n="609"/> measure <foreign lang="ar">مَفْعُولٌ</foreign>; but accord. to the A, it is not so, because its fem. is with <foreign lang="ar">ة</foreign>; but is from the supposed verb <foreign lang="ar">حَقُقَ</foreign>, and is like <foreign lang="ar">خَلِيقٌ</foreign> from <foreign lang="ar">خَلُقَ</foreign>, and <foreign lang="ar">جَدِيرٌ</foreign> from <foreign lang="ar">جَدُرَ</foreign>: and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8572-3" target="مَحْقُوقٌ" n="3" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n8583"/></foreign> signifies [properly] <hi rend="ital">rendered adapted</hi> &amp;c.: (TA:) the pl. of <foreign lang="ar">حقيق</foreign> is <foreign lang="ar">أَحِقَّآءُ</foreign>; and that of   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8572-4" target="محقوق" n="4" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign> is <foreign lang="ar">مَحْقُوقُونَ</foreign>. (S.) You say, <foreign lang="ar">هُوَ حَقِيقٌ بِهِ</foreign> (Sh, S, Msb, K) and <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8572-5" target="مَحْقُوقٌ" n="5" type="5" subtype="FSO" lang="ar" select="n8583"/>به</foreign> (Sh, S, K) and <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8572-6" target="حَقٌّ" n="6" type="5" subtype="FSO" lang="ar" select="n8564"/>به</foreign> (Ibn-'Abbád, K) [<hi rend="ital">He is adapted,</hi> &amp;c., <hi rend="ital">for it;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">worthy of it</hi>]. And to a woman, <foreign lang="ar">أَنْتَ حَقِيقَةٌ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">بِكَذَا</foreign> (A, TA) and <foreign lang="ar">حَقِيقَةٌ لِذٰلِكَ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8572-7" target="مَحْقُوقَةٌ" n="7" type="5" subtype="FSO" lang="ar"/>لِذٰلِكَ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">Thou art adapted,</hi> &amp;c., <hi rend="ital">for such a thing</hi> and <hi rend="ital">for that thing;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">worthy of it</hi>]. (TA.) And <foreign lang="ar">أَنْتَ حَقِيقٌ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">بِأَنْ تَفْعَلَ</foreign> (A, Mgh) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8572-8" target="مَحْقُوقٌ" n="8" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n8583"/></foreign> (A) [<hi rend="ital">Thou art adapted,</hi> &amp;c., <hi rend="ital">for thy doing</hi> such a thing; or <hi rend="ital">worthy of doing</hi> it]. And <foreign lang="ar">هُوَ حَقِيقٌ أَنْ يَفْعَلَ كَذَا</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">He is adapted,</hi> &amp;c., <hi rend="ital">for his doing such a thing;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">worthy to do it</hi>]; (S;) in which case, <foreign lang="ar">ان</foreign> is for <foreign lang="ar">بِأَنْ</foreign>. (Mgh.) [And <foreign lang="ar">حَقِيقٌ بِكَذَا</foreign> also signifies <hi rend="ital">Having a right,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">just title</hi> or <hi rend="ital">claim, to such a thing; entitled to such a thing.</hi>] It is said in the Kur [vii. 103], <foreign lang="ar">حَقِيقٌ عَلَى أَنْ لَا أَقْولَ عَلَى</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">ٱللّٰهِ إِلَّا الحَقَّ</foreign>, meaning I am <hi rend="ital">disposed</hi> [<hi rend="ital">not</hi>] <hi rend="ital">to say</hi> [<hi rend="ital">of God</hi> aught <hi rend="ital">save</hi>] <hi rend="ital">the truth:</hi> or, as some say, I am <hi rend="ital">vehemently desirous</hi> [<hi rend="ital">that I should not say</hi> &amp;c.]; for, accord. to Aboo-'Alee, <foreign lang="ar">أَنَا حَقِيقٌ عَلَى</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">كَذَا</foreign> means <hi rend="ital">I am vehemently desirous of such a thing:</hi> but one reading, that of Náfi', is <foreign lang="ar">حَقِيقٌ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">عَلَىَّ أَنْ لَا أَقُولَ</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">It is binding,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">obligatory,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">incumbent, on me</hi> [<hi rend="ital">that I should not say</hi>].                   <hi rend="ital">i. q.</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">صَادِقٌ</foreign> [as used in the phrase <foreign lang="ar">صَادِقُ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">الحَلَاوَةِ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">صَادِقُ الحَمْلَةِ</foreign>, &amp;c.: see art. <foreign lang="ar">صدق</foreign>]: so in the phrase <foreign lang="ar">حَاقٌّ الجُوعِ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">Vehement hunger</hi>]: (K:) occurring in a trad. of Aboo-Bekr: but accord. to one reading, it is <foreign lang="ar">حَاقُ الجُوعِ</foreign>, without teshdeed to the <foreign lang="ar">ق</foreign>, from <foreign lang="ar">حَاقَ بِهِ البَلَآءُ</foreign>, inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">حَيْقٌ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">حَاقٌ</foreign>, “ trial, or trouble, beset him; ” and means <hi rend="ital">the besetting of hunger:</hi> or it may mean <foreign lang="ar">حَائِقُ الجُوعِ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">besetting hunger</hi>]. (TA.) One says also, <foreign lang="ar">رَجُلٌ حَاقُّ الرَّجُلِ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8577-1" target="حَاقَّةُ" n="1" type="5" subtype="FSO" lang="ar"/>الرَّجُلِ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">A man perfect in manliness:</hi> and <foreign lang="ar">حَاقُّ الشُّجَاعِ</foreign> and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8577-2" target="حَاقَّةُ" n="2" lang="ar" type="7" subtype="WOTF"/> الشُّجَاعِ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">perfect in courage.</hi> (K, * TA.) And Az relates that he heard an Arab of the desert say, of a mark of mange, or scab, that appeared upon a camel, <foreign lang="ar">هٰذَا حَاقُّ صُمَادِحِ الجَرَبِ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">This is a most sure,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a truth-telling, evidence of genuine mange,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">scab</hi>]. (TA.)       <sense type="A" n="2">-A2-</sense>  Also The <hi rend="ital">middle</hi> of the head; (S, K;) as also   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8577-3" target="حَقٌّ" n="3" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n8564"/></foreign>: (K:) and of the back of the neck; as also   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8577-4" target="حُقٌّ" n="4" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n8565"/></foreign>: (TA: [thus the latter is there written, in this instance, with damm:]) and of the eye: (TA:) and of a road: (K, * TA:) and of winter.                   <foreign lang="ar">رَأْسِهِ</foreign> (S, K) and <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8577-5" target="حَقِّ" n="5" type="5" subtype="FSO" lang="ar"/>رأسه</foreign> (K) <hi rend="ital">He fell upon the middle of his head:</hi> (S, K:) and <foreign lang="ar">على حَاقِّ القَفَا</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8577-6" target="حُقِّ" n="6" type="5" subtype="FSO" lang="ar"/>القفا</foreign>

                  <foreign lang="ar">حَاقَّ الطَّرِيقِ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He went upon the middle of the road.</hi> (K, * TA.) And <foreign lang="ar">جِئْتُهُ فِى حَاقِّ الشِّتَآءِ</foreign>

                  <foreign lang="ar">كَذَا</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He is in straitness by reason of such a thing.</hi> (TA.)    </entryFree>37:Ta4f,<entryFree id="n8578" key="حَاقَّةٌ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">حَاقَّةٌ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">حاق</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">حاقه</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">حاقة</orth>
                  </form>: see <foreign lang="ar">حَقِيقَةٌ</foreign>, in two places. [In the sense in which it is there explained, its pl. is <foreign lang="ar">حَوَاقُّ</foreign>; and so in other senses; agreeably with analogy: see the second of the sentences here following.]          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  Also <hi rend="ital">A severe calamity</hi> or <hi rend="ital">affliction, the happening of which is fixed,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">established;</hi> and so   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8578-1" target="حَقَّةٌ" n="1" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n8567"/></foreign>; (K;) which signifies also, [according to another explanation,] like   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n8578-2" target="حُقَّةٌ" n="2" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n8568"/></foreign>, [simply,] <hi rend="ital">a calamity;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a great, formidable, terrible,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">momentous, thing,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">event:</hi> (Az, K:) and <foreign lang="ar">حَاجَةٌ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">حَاقَّةٌ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">a want that befalls,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">happens, and is severe,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">distressing.</hi> (Msb.)          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  And <foreign lang="ar">الحَاقَّةُ</foreign> [in the Kur lxix. 1 and 2] means <hi rend="ital">The resurrection:</hi> (S, Msb, K:) because in it shall be [manifest] the true natures (<foreign lang="ar">حَوَاقّ</foreign>) of things, or actions; or because in it shall be [or shall happen (Bd)] severe calamities (<foreign lang="ar">حَوَاقُّ الأُمُورِ</foreign>); (Fr, S, Bd, K;) namely, the reckoning and the recompensing: (Bd:) or because in it things shall be surely known (Bd, Jel) which are denied; namely, the raising of the dead, and the reckoning, and the recompensing: (Jel:) or because including within its sphere [all] the created beings. (Msb. [Several other reasons are assigned; but these which I have mentioned appear to be the most generally approved.])          <sense type="b" n="4">-b4-</sense>  See also <foreign lang="ar">حَاقٌّ</foreign>, in two places.    </entryFree>38:Tdd1,<entryFree id="n8579" key="أَحَقُّ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">أَحَقُّ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form> [comparative and superlative of <foreign lang="ar">حَقِيقٌ</foreign>]. You say, <foreign lang="ar">هُوَ أَحَقُّ بِكَذَا</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">He is more,</hi> and <hi rend="ital">most, adapted, disposed, apt, meet, suited, suitable, fitted, fit, proper,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">competent, for such a thing;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">more,</hi> and <hi rend="ital">most, worthy,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">deserving, of it:</hi> and <hi rend="ital">he has a better,</hi> and <hi rend="ital">the best, right to such a thing;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a more just,</hi> and <hi rend="ital">the most just, title</hi> or <hi rend="ital">claim</hi> 
                  <pb n="610"/> 
                  <hi rend="ital">to it;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">he is more,</hi> and <hi rend="ital">most, entitled to it</hi>]: this phrase is used in two senses: first, as denoting the possession of an exclusive right or title, i. e., without the participation of another; as when you say, <foreign lang="ar">زَيْدٌ أَحَقُّ بِمَالِهِ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">Zeyd is entitled to his property exclusively of any other person:</hi> secondly, as denoting the possession of a right or title in participation with another person, but in a superior degree; as in the saying, <foreign lang="ar">الأَيِّمُ أَحَقُّ بِنَفْسِهَا</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">مِنْ وَلِيِّهَا</foreign>, (Msb,) i. e. <hi rend="ital">The woman that has not a husband and is not a virgin</hi> [<hi rend="ital">is more entitled to dispose of herself than is her guardian</hi>]; (Mgh in art. <foreign lang="ar">ايم</foreign>;) meaning that they participate [in the right], but that her right is the stronger: (Msb:) a saying of Mohammad, in which the <foreign lang="ar">ايّم</foreign> is opposed to the <foreign lang="ar">بِكْر</foreign>, for it is added that the <foreign lang="ar">بكر</foreign> is to be asked her permission: but one reading substitutes <foreign lang="ar">الثَّيِّبُ</foreign> for <foreign lang="ar">الايّم</foreign>. (Mgh ubi suprà.) In the saying, in the Kur [v. 106], <foreign lang="ar">لَشَهَادَتُنَا أَحَقُّ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">مِنْ شَهَادَتِهِمَا</foreign>, it may be formed from <foreign lang="ar">اِسْتَحَقَّ</foreign> by rejection of the augmentative letters, so that the meaning is, [<hi rend="ital">Verily our testimony is</hi>] <hi rend="ital">more deserving of being accepted</hi> [<hi rend="ital">than the testimony of them two</hi>]: or it may be from <foreign lang="ar">حَقَّ الشَّىْءُ</foreign> signifying <foreign lang="ar">ثَبَتَ</foreign>, and so mean <hi rend="ital">more true,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">valid.</hi> (TA.)       <sense type="A" n="2">-A2-</sense>  Applied to a horse, <hi rend="ital">That does not sweat.</hi> (S, K.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  And, likewise thus applied, <hi rend="ital">That puts down his hind hoof in the place</hi> [<hi rend="ital">that has just before been that</hi>] <hi rend="ital">of his fore hoof.</hi> (S, * K.) [See <foreign lang="ar">حَقَقٌ</foreign>.]    </entryFree>11:["$","$Lc",null,{"direction":"row","alignItems":"flex-start","width":"100%","background":"white","padding":{"base":"16px 8px","md":"24px
